result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase A. Marceau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: original filed in 15CM102

Defendant Chase A. Marceau in court with attorney Robert a Gardner. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:44 a.m.   Court calls the case. 
All files heard today: 16CF147, 16CF273, 16CF274, 16CF330, 16CF331, 16CF397, 16CF412, 15CM102

Attorney discuss the plea agreement given there were additional cases after the plea was done. 
8:46 a.m.  Court will take a recess to allow for Atty Gardner to discuss the matter with his client. 

9:06 a.m.  Court recalls the case.  Appearances remain the same. 

16CF330, 16CF331, 16CF397, 16CF412 WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARINGS AND ARRAIGNMENTS CONDUCTED AT THIS TIME:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Informations.
Defendant received copy of informations.
Defendant waives reading of informations. 

NOT GUILTY Pleas entered to all counts in 16CF330 Counts 1 thru 5, 16CF331, 16CF397, 16CF412.

Plea questionnaires/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF147 Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST
16CF330 Counts 6 & 7 - NO CONTEST
15CM102 Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF147 Counts 1 & 3, 16CF330 Counts 6 & 7, 15CM102 Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and Read-in: 16CF147 Counts 2 & 4, 16CF273, 16CF274, 16CF330 Counts 1 thru 5, 15CM102 Count 2, 16CF331, 16CF397, 16CF412

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF147 Counts 1 & 3 -
60 days jail, STAYED Consecutive to any other sentence he is serving. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Eligible for home monitor if, after an assessment is made, he is found eligible. 
Allowed to transfer the supervision and jail time to Wood County. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Only use one pharmacy to obtain legal prescriptions and sign releases so agent can monitor compliance.
Obtain mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Pursue high school diploma if deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Participate in any other assessment and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Write letter of apology to Portage House.
Provide DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge to be paid during term of probation. 

15CM102 Counts 1 & 2 - 
60 days jail, concurrent to each other but consecutive to 16CF147 and any other sentence he is serving.  STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Eligible for home monitor if, after an assessment is made, he is found eligible. 
Allowed to transfer the supervision and jail time to Wood County. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent with 16CF147.
Comply with the conditions of probation in 16CF147.
Comply with the injunction order in Adams County file 14JI1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

ANY BONDS POSTED SHALL BE APPLIED TO THE FINES AND COSTS. 

16CF330 Counts 6 & 7 - 
60 days jail on each count concurrent to each other and concurrent to the time in 16CF147.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Eligible for home monitor if, after an assessment is made, he is found eligible. 
Allowed to transfer the supervision and jail time to Wood County. 
Placed on probation for 24 months:  
Same conditions as 16CF147.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Atty Gardner asks to transfer to Wood County in the event he is revoked. 

BY THE COURT:  0 days jail credit.

Cases heard today are 15CM102, 16CF147, 16CF273 and 16CF274.


1:40 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Court questions where the defendant was this morning.
Atty Knaapen would request that  the bond on the above cases be reinstated. 

BY THE COURT:
Warrants are quashed.
Bond reinstated on the cases as listed above
Body only
